layer.name: Discipline
layer.definition: Do what needs doing, especially when you don't feel like it.

questions.text: When I sense conviction about something, I ...
questions.principle: Do not lie, especially to yourself

answers.4: usually respond fairly promptly, though occasionally I drag my feet
answers.5: act — delay only makes it harder
answers.2: feel it but usually talk myself out of acting on it
answers.3: act sometimes, but often delay until the urgency fades
answers.1: have gotten skilled at ignoring it — it rarely changes my behavior

answers.4: usually make things right within a few days, though I dread the conversation
answers.5: confess quickly — unresolved wrongs are worse than the awkwardness
answers.2: might apologize eventually but procrastinate until it's awkward to bring up
answers.3: confess sometimes, but often only when forced or when discomfort becomes unbearable
answers.1: avoid confronting it — time heals all wounds, right?

questions.text: When an opportunity violates my values but would benefit me, I ...

answers.4: usually say no, though some situations really test me
answers.5: say no — no benefit is worth compromising who I am
answers.2: feel conflicted but usually rationalize why this compromise is okay
answers.3: hold the line on big things but let smaller compromises slide
answers.1: bend my values — benefit comes first

questions.text: When a small commitment becomes inconvenient, I ...
questions.principle: Your word is your bond with reality

answers.4: usually keep it, though I'm tempted to let it go
answers.5: keep it — my word is my word
answers.2: usually let it slide — it's not a big deal
answers.1: drop it without much thought — no one's keeping track

questions.text: When I notice I'm justifying questionable behavior, I ...

answers.4: usually recognize it and course correct
answers.5: stop — I know my patterns and catch them early
answers.2: sometimes notice but usually keep going anyway
answers.3: catch myself sometimes and occasionally stop to examine it
answers.1: keep going — I'm excellent at making anything seem reasonable

remediation.advice: Jordan Peterson's rule: 'Tell the truth, or at least don't lie.' Start there. Every rationalization weakens your conscience; every honest act strengthens it. Make one difficult confession this week.

scripture.text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
